author: Pliny the Elder

quote: Unfortunately, it is human nature for us to only learn and grow from a place of emptiness. It's hard to learn when we are winning and on top of the world.
author: Yehuda Berg

quote: Deism is the belief that nature and God are one and the same thing. If you study nature, you're getting insights about God.
author: Bruce Lipton

quote: There's one fundamental law that all of nature obeys that mankind breaks every day. Now, this is a law that's evolved over billions of years, and the law is this: Nothing in nature takes more than it needs.
author: Tom Shadyac

quote: Religion is never going to go away, and anyone who thinks it will doesn't understand what religion is. It is a language to describe the experience of human nature, so for as long as people struggle to describe what it means to be alive, it will be a ready-made language to express those feelings.
author: Reza Aslan

quote: What nature delivers to us is never stale. Because what nature creates has eternity in it.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: Energy, like the biblical grain of the mustard-seed, will remove mountains.
author: Hosea Ballou

quote: Nature was my kindergarten.
author: William Christopher Handy

quote: Understanding the laws of nature does not mean that we are immune to their operations.
author: David Gerrold

quote: Grandeur and sublimity, not softness, are the features of Estes Park. The glades which begin so softly are soon lost in the dark primaeval forests, with their peaks of rosy granite and their stretches of granite blocks piled and poised by nature in some mood of fury.
author: Isabella Bird

quote: Santa Cruz is blessed not only with natural wonders, but also with gifted souls who can fashion nature's bounty into man-made treasures.
author: Clive Sinclair

quote: Nothing makes me so happy as to observe nature and to paint what I see.
author: Henri Rousseau

quote: Art owes its origin to Nature herself... this beautiful creation, the world, supplied the first model, while the original teacher was that divine intelligence which has not only made us superior to the other animals, but like God Himself, if I may venture to say it.
author: Giorgio Vasari

quote: It was one of those perfect English autumnal days which occur more frequently in memory than in life.
author: P. D. James

quote: There is nothing in which the birds differ more from man than the way in which they can build and yet leave a landscape as it was before.
author: Robert Wilson Lynd

quote: My recollection of a hundred lovely lakes has given me blessed release from care and worry and the troubled thinking of our modern day. It has been a return to the primitive and the peaceful.
author: Hamlin Garland

quote: The moment a little boy is concerned with which is a jay and which is a sparrow, he can no longer see the birds or hear them sing.
author: Eric Berne

quote: For as the eyes of bats are to the blaze of day, so is the reason in our soul to the things which are by nature most evident of all.
author: Aristotle

quote: Except during the nine months before he draws his first breath, no man manages his affairs as well as a tree does.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: I was trying to do too many things at the same time, which is my nature. But I was enjoying it, and I still do enjoy it.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: Happy the man whose wish and care a few paternal acres bound, content to breathe his native air in his own ground.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Man has lost the capacity to foresee and to forestall. He will end by destroying the earth.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: There is the sky, which is all men's together.
author: Euripides

quote: I am two with nature.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Nature is the art of God.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: For relaxation, I like to figure skate. Being on the ice and spinning and jumping, I feel very close to nature. In particular, I feel very close to Newton's laws of motion. On the ice, you can experience Newton's laws of motion in their purest, most elegant form.
author: Michio Kaku

quote: I don't think I'm morbid by nature. Serious writers have always written about serious subjects. Lighthearted material doesn't appeal to me, and I don't read it. I think I'm a realist, with a realistic sensibility of history and the tragedy of history.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: People from a planet without flowers would think we must be mad with joy the whole time to have such things about us.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: Occasionally I have come across a last patch of snow on top of a mountain in late May or June. There's something very powerful about finding snow in summer.
author: Andy Goldsworthy

quote: What law, what reason can deny that gift so sweet, so natural that God has given a stream, a fish, a beast, a bird?
author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

quote: These flowers, which were splendid and sprightly, waking in the dawn of the morning, in the evening will be a pitiful frivolity, sleeping in the cold night's arms.
author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

quote: All nature wears one universal grin.
author: Henry Fielding

quote: My family was very conservative, and I had a traditional upbringing. I was not brought up to be a sex symbol, nor is it in my nature to be one. The fact that I became one is probably the loveliest, most glamorous and fortunate misunderstanding.
author: Raquel Welch

quote: Nothing is farther than earth from heaven; nothing is nearer than heaven to earth.
author: Augustus Hare

quote: Having plants and flowers in my space makes me feel very calm and Zen. For me, it's important to meditate every morning to be very clear in the head, and nature really helps me do the same thing.
author: Nicola Formichetti

quote: In nature there are few sharp lines.
author: A. R. Ammons

quote: Sound is the vocabulary of nature.
author: Pierre Schaeffer

quote: We talk of our mastery of nature, which sounds very grand; but the fact is we respectfully adapt ourselves, first, to her ways.
author: Clarence Day

quote: Bats drink on the wing, like swallows, by sipping the surface, as they play over pools and streams.
author: Gilbert White

quote: I've always regarded nature as the clothing of God.
author: Alan Hovhaness

quote: Nature's music is never over; her silences are pauses, not conclusions.
author: Mary Webb

quote: The cool wind blew in my face and all at once I felt as if I had shed dullness from myself. Before me lay a long gray line with a black mark down the center. The birds were singing. It was spring.
author: Burl Ives

quote: I've made an odd discovery. Every time I talk to a savant I feel quite sure that happiness is no longer a possibility. Yet when I talk with my gardener, I'm convinced of the opposite.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Spring beckons! All things to the call respond; the trees are leaving and cashiers abscond.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: The counterfeit and counterpart of Nature is reproduced in art.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Like music and art, love of nature is a common language that can transcend political or social boundaries.
author: Jimmy Carter

quote: Swans sing before they die - 'twere no bad thing should certain persons die before they sing.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: No tendency is quite so strong in human nature as the desire to lay down rules of conduct for other people.
author: William Howard Taft

quote: Nature is a good name for an effect whose cause is God.
author: William Cowper

quote: The mind, in proportion as it is cut off from free communication with nature, with revelation, with God, with itself, loses its life, just as the body droops when debarred from the air and the cheering light from heaven.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Poor, dear, silly Spring, preparing her annual surprise!
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: Those little nimble musicians of the air, that warble forth their curious ditties, with which nature hath furnished them to the shame of art.
author: Izaak Walton

quote: Where hast thou wandered, gentle gale, to find the perfumes thou dost bring?
author: William C. Bryant

quote: The moon is at her full, and riding high, Floods the calm fields with light. The airs that hover in the summer sky Are all asleep tonight.
author: William C. Bryant

quote: The world is always in movement.
author: V. S. Naipaul

quote: It is only in the country that we can get to know a person or a book.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: There's always a period of curious fear between the first sweet-smelling breeze and the time when the rain comes cracking down.
author: Don DeLillo

quote: I love the long grass coming up to meet the willows.
author: Jilly Cooper

quote: We are embedded in a biological world and related to the organisms around us.
author: Walter Gilbert

quote: Nature is the master of talents; genius is the master of nature.
author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

quote: To destroy is still the strongest instinct in nature.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: Having contemplated this admirable grove, I proceeded towards the shrubberies on the banks of the river, and though it was now late in December, the aromatic groves appeared in full bloom.
author: William Bartram

quote: My progress was rendered delightful by the sylvan elegance of the groves, chearful meadows, and high distant forests, which in grand order presented themselves to view.
author: William Bartram

quote: The earth is yet the place of the domicile of man and all the offspring of the first man.
author: Joseph Franklin Rutherford

quote: The fulness of the godhead dwelt in every blade of grass.
author: Elias Hicks

quote: A tree is an incomprehensible mystery.
author: Jim Woodring

quote: In some mysterious way woods have never seemed to me to be static things. In physical terms, I move through them; yet in metaphysical ones, they seem to move through me.
author: John Fowles

quote: Nature is inside art as its content, not outside as its model.
author: Marilyn French

quote: For every person who has ever lived there has come, at last, a spring he will never see. Glory then in the springs that are yours.
author: Pam Brown

quote: Custom, that is before all law; Nature, that is above all art.
author: Samuel Daniel

quote: The stars that have most glory have no rest.
author: Samuel Daniel

quote: Nature's far too subtle to repeat herself.
author: Paul Muni

quote: Maybe nature is fundamentally ugly, chaotic and complicated. But if it's like that, then I want out.
author: Steven Weinberg

quote: People in cities may forget the soil for as long as a hundred years, but Mother Nature's memory is long and she will not let them forget indefinitely.
author: Henry Cantwell Wallace
